security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and writing guidance. No executable code, no file access, no network calls, no environment access. Contains only markdown text with prompts for AI assistants to follow when reviewing text.

content.user_title: Remove AI Writing Artifacts from Docs
content.value_statement: Documentation generated by AI often contains telltale patterns like excessive emdashes, formulaic phrases, and forced enthusiasm. This skill provides systematic prompts and guidelines to identify and remove these artifacts so your documentation sounds authentically human.
actual_capabilities: Identify excessive emdash usage and suggest alternatives
Detect formulaic phrases like 'It's not X, it's Y' and 'Here's why'
Flag forced enthusiasm patterns like 'Let's dive in'
Offer concrete before and after transformation examples
Suggest recasting sentences to sound naturally human
limitations: Does not automatically edit files; requires user to apply changes
Not an automated tool; relies on AI assistant following prompts
Does not check grammar, spelling, or technical accuracy
Does not preserve original versions; user must backup if needed

use_cases.title: Polish project README files
use_cases.description: Remove AI writing tells from project documentation to make your open source project feel more authentic and professional.

use_cases.title: Refine documentation drafts
use_cases.description: Review API documentation and guides to eliminate formulaic patterns and achieve a natural human voice.

use_cases.title: Humanize AI-assisted writing
use_cases.description: Transform AI-generated blog posts and articles into content that sounds genuinely written by a person.

prompt_templates.title: Full De-Slopify Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Read through this text carefully and look for any telltale signs of AI slop style writing. Replace excessive emdashes with semicolons, commas, or recast sentences. Avoid 'It's not X, it's Y', 'Here's why', and similar formulaic patterns. Manually read each line and revise systematically. Use ultrathink.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Touch-Up
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this text and remove AI slop patterns: excessive emdashes, 'Here's why' constructions, 'It's not X, it's Y' formulas, and other LLM writing tells. Recast sentences to sound more naturally human. Use ultrathink.

prompt_templates.title: Emdash Focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Focus on emdash usage in this text. For each emdash, decide whether to replace with semicolon, comma, or recast the sentence entirely. Sometimes splitting into two sentences works best. Keep the meaning intact while improving flow.

prompt_templates.title: Phrase Elimination
prompt_templates.prompt: Find and rewrite these AI tells: 'Here's why', 'Let's dive in', 'In this guide we'll', 'It's worth noting that', 'At its core'. Replace with direct, natural phrasing. Delete unnecessary hedges and pseudo-profound openers.

output_examples.input: We built this amazing tool‚Äîand it works great. Here's why it matters: performance is key. It's not just a linter, it's a complete system. Let's dive in!
output: Found 3 emdashes: replaced with commas and restructured
Removed 'Here's why it matters': explained importance directly
Rewrote 'It's not just a linter' to 'This complete system goes beyond basic linting'
Removed 'Let's dive in': replaced with direct transition

best_practices: Apply prompts before final publication, not during initial drafting
Review each change manually to ensure meaning is preserved
Focus on prose and natural flow; leave code examples untouched
anti_patterns: Using automated scripts or regex to remove patterns without understanding context
Removing all LLM-style patterns without considering if they add value
Over-editing to the point of losing technical accuracy or clarity

faq.question: Which AI tools work with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. The prompts are designed for any capable AI assistant.

faq.question: Does this skill edit files automatically?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides prompts for AI assistants to follow. You must apply the suggested changes yourself.

faq.question: What writing patterns does it detect?
faq.answer: It identifies emdash overuse, formulaic contrasts, clickbait-style leads, forced enthusiasm, and unnecessary hedges.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only contains prompts. Your data is processed by your chosen AI assistant following those prompts.

faq.question: How is this different from grammar checkers?
faq.answer: Grammar checkers fix mechanical errors. This skill addresses style authenticity‚Äîpatterns that make writing sound artificially generated.

faq.question: Can I use this for non-English text?
faq.answer: The prompts are in English and target English writing patterns. Results may vary for other languages.
